abstract: Prince Mohammed bin Nayef, newly appointed deputy crown prince of Saudi Arabia, embodies nation's shift to a more assertive foreign policy; will continue tactics he developed as interior minister, propping up allies and quashing foreign political foes and domestic dissent; Nayef, now second in line for throne, is key aspect of generational shift in the Saudi royal family following the death of King Abdullah.
lead_paragraph: Prince Mohammed bin Nayef, the new deputy crown prince, embodies Saudi Arabia’s shift to a more assertive foreign policy, analysts say.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

snippet: Prince Mohammed bin Nayef, the new deputy crown prince, embodies Saudi Arabia’s shift to a more assertive foreign policy, analysts say.

headline.main: Saudi Succession Hints at Shift in Foreign Role
headline.print_headline: Saudi Succession Hinting at Shift in Foreign Role
